reviews.text: We arrived to find that there was no attendant and we struggled to find our tickets as only popular destinations listed. The young girl and gentleman in the coffee shop helped as much as they could and when we had got what we needed (through the ‘help’ machine) she brought over a croissant for our daughter to apologize for the inconvenience even though nothing was their fault. Brilliant customer experience and genuine kindness 🥰

Very hard to get to the platform if you have a pushchair, staff don’t help either unless you ask and only do it if they have nothing else to do and sometimes no one is there. I had to help to help a mother with a pushchair even when there was 10 railway staff controlling tickets and ignored the poor lady. It not a pushchair or wheelchair friendly at all.
Has toilets, Ticket office and functional ticket machines. Good station
What can you say about a railway station ? It does what it's designed for If you can't manage the stairs there is an underpass at the other end of the platform
It's a railway station! Not much else to say.
